Generation I.Red: A rare and elusive Pok é mon that is said to bring happiness to those who manage to get it.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: A rare and elusive Pok é mon that is said to bring happiness to those who manage to get it.
Generation I.Yellow: A gentle and kind-hearted Pok é mon that shares its nutritious eggs if it sees an injured Pok é mon .
Generation I.Stadium: Lays very succulent eggs every day. If it is treated with love and care, its eggs appear to become even more delicious.

Generation II.Gold: It walks carefully to prevent its egg from breaking. However, it is extremely fast at running away.
Generation II.Silver: Few in number and difficult to capture, it is said to bring happiness to the trainer who catches it.
Generation II.Crystal: People try to catch it for its extremely nutritious eggs, but it rarely can be found.
Generation II.Stadium 2: It walks carefully to prevent its egg from breaking. However, it is extremely fast at running away. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) Few in number and difficult to capture, it is said to bring happiness to the trainer who catches it. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Chansey lays nutritionally excellent eggs on an everyday basis. The eggs are so delicious, they are easily and eagerly devoured by even those people who have lost their appetite.
Generation III.Sapphire: Chansey lays nutritionally excellent eggs on an everyday basis. The eggs are so delicious, they are easily and eagerly devoured by even those people who have lost their appetite.
Generation III.Emerald: Chansey lay nutritionally excellent eggs every day. The eggs are so delicious, they are eagerly devoured by even those people who have lost their appetite.
Generation III.FireRed: It lays several eggs a day. The eggs are apparently rich in nutrients and extremely delicious.
Generation III.LeafGreen: A rare and elusive Pok é mon that is said to bring happiness to those who manage to catch one.

Generation IV.Diamond: It is said to deliver happiness. Being compassionate, it shares its eggs with injured people.
Generation IV.Pearl: It lays several eggs a day and won't share them with those who have evil in their hearts.
Generation IV.Platinum: A kindly Pokémon that lays highly nutritious eggs and shares them with injured Pokémon or people.
Generation IV.HeartGold: It walks carefully to prevent its egg from breaking. However, it is extremely fast at running away.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Being few in number and difficult to capture, it is said to bring happiness to the Trainer who catches it.

Generation V.White: A kindly Pokémon that lays highly nutritious eggs and shares them with injured Pokémon or people.
Generation V.Black 2: A kindly Pokémon that lays highly nutritious eggs and shares them with injured Pokémon or people.
Generation V.White 2: A kindly Pokémon that lays highly nutritious eggs and shares them with injured Pokémon or people.

Generation VI.X: It is said to deliver happiness. Being compassionate, it shares its eggs with injured people.
Generation VI.Y: It lays several eggs a day. The eggs are apparently rich in nutrients and extremely delicious.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Chansey lays nutritionally excellent eggs on an everyday basis. The eggs are so delicious, they are easily and eagerly devoured by even those people who have lost their appetite.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Chansey lays nutritionally excellent eggs on an everyday basis. The eggs are so delicious, they are easily and eagerly devoured by even those people who have lost their appetite.

Generation VII.Sun: The eggs laid by Chansey are rich in nutrients and a favorite food of many Pokémon.
Generation VII.Moon: Not only are these Pokémon fast runners, they're also few in number, so anyone who finds one must be lucky indeed.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: It seems that other Pokémon's efforts to take its delicious, nutritious egg away from it caused Chansey to get faster at fleeing.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Because the eggs on their bellies have been overharvested by people in the past, the Chansey population remains very small.
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: A gentle and kindhearted Pokémon that shares its nutritious eggs if it sees an injured Pokémon.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: A gentle and kindhearted Pokémon that shares its nutritious eggs if it sees an injured Pokémon.

Generation VIII.Sword: The egg Chansey carries is not only delicious but also packed with nutrition. It's used as a high-class cooking ingredient.
Generation VIII.Shield: This species was once very slow. To protect their eggs from other creatures, these Pokémon became able to flee quickly.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It is said to deliver happiness. Being compassionate, it shares its eggs with injured people.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It lays several eggs a day and won't share them with those who have evil in their hearts.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: This purehearted Pokémon shares its eggs with the injured. These eggs are so nutritious that they've been nicknamed "doctors' doubles."

Generation IX.Scarlet: This kindly Pokémon lays highly nutritious eggs and shares them with injured Pokémon or people.
Generation IX.Violet: It walks carefully to prevent its egg from breaking. However, it is extremely fast at running away.
